title: Define split for .adaf scope: commit shared project state, keep session telemetry local
description:
Proposal:

- Keep two categories of `.adaf` state separate:
  - Structural/project knowledge: plans, issues, decisions, docs, config (durable, collaborative, commit-friendly).
  - Operational telemetry: recordings, sessions, active loop/spawn/worktree runtime state (large/noisy/sensitive).

Suggested structure:
.adaf/
  plan.json
  issues/
  decisions/
  docs/
  config.json
  local/
    sessions/
    recordings/
    loops/
    spawns/

Notes:
1) Structural artifacts should remain in `./.adaf/` and be committed so cloned repos immediately carry relay context (plans/issues/docs/decisions).
2) Full session recordings should stay local-only (or under ignored local subdir) because they are chatty and may contain secrets.
3) Raw session logs/recordings are operational and should not be committed by default; summaries/digests can be committed as part of project memory if useful.
4) `adaf` CLI should auto-commit structural mutations (`issue`, `plan`, `decision`, etc.) with standardized message prefix, e.g. `adaf: create issue #NN ...`, while making this behavior configurable for users who prefer manual batching.
5) Agents should never mutate `.adaf` files directly; they call `adaf` commands and CLI handles persistence/commit policy.
6) Humans can still manually edit `.adaf` JSON when needed.

Open question for implementation: should operational data be moved under `./.adaf/local/` (gitignored) versus `~/.adaf/<project-hash>/`? The current repository hint suggests intent for both
